keyword: how many calories in scrambled eggs
title: How Many Calories in Scrambled Eggs?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in scrambled eggs for a standard 2-egg serving, including protein, fat, carbs, and nutrition tweaks for different preparations.
h1: How Many Calories in Scrambled Eggs?
assumptions: 2 large eggs (~50 g each) scrambled with 1 tsp butter and 1 tbsp low-fat milk; no additional salt or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, milk type, cooking method, and portion; check recipes or labels for precision.

quick_answer.text: A 2-egg serving of scrambled eggs provides ~182 kcal and ~12 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: No added butter or milk (plain scrambled)
Use oil instead of butter (1 tsp olive oil)

faqs.q: How many calories in one scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 91 kcal for one large scrambled egg with minimal butter and milk.

faqs.q: Are scrambled eggs high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, 2 scrambled eggs offer ~12 g protein, making them a good source.

faqs.q: Do scrambled eggs have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Depends on preparation; a 2-egg serving with butter has ~14 g total fat, including 6 g saturated.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Added oils or butter increase calories; non-stick pan with no fat reduces them by ~50 kcal per serving.

faqs.q: What about cholesterol in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: 2 eggs contain ~406 mg cholesterol, mostly from the yolks; moderation is key for some diets.
